Note.Content: Though it is possible to understand the expression vomit out of the mouth as being an idiom meaning to reject, it is probably better to assume that this expression (ἐμέω ἐκ τοῦ στόματος) is simply used figuratively rather than being a conventionalized idiom.

LEXSubDomains.LEXSubDomain: Processes Involving the Mouth, Other Than Eating and Drinking

LEXSense.Comments: Since a term meaning ‘to vomit’ often carries somewhat vulgar connotations, ἐμέω in {S:06600301600024} has frequently been translated as ‘to spit out of my mouth.’|It is also possible to interpret ‘to vomit out of the mouth’ as an idiom meaning ‘to reject.’{N:001}
